summary:
The Security Council:
 
Recalling previous resolutions and statements on the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), 
Reaffirming the sovereignty, territorial integrity and political independence of the DRC and all States in the region, 
Reaffirming the obligation of all States to refrain from using force against any State's territorial integrity and political independence, 
Noting with concern the illegal exploitation of the DRC's natural resources, 
Deploring continued hostilities, ceasefire violations, and lack of progress on inter-Congolese dialogue, 
Reaffirming support for the Lusaka Ceasefire Agreement, 
Welcoming agreements on disengagement of forces and the Harare Agreement, 
Taking note of the Government of the DRC's support for MONUC deployment, 
Recalling parties' responsibility to cooperate with MONUC, 
Expressing concern over the humanitarian situation, 
Serious concern over human rights and international humanitarian law violations, 
Concerned at increased HIV/AIDS infection, child soldiers recruitment, 
Commending MONUC personnel's work, 
Welcoming African leaders' diplomatic initiatives, 

Decides to extend MONUC's mandate until 15 June 2001; 
Calls on parties to cease hostilities, intensify dialogue to implement the Lusaka Ceasefire Agreement and related agreements; 
Calls on parties, particularly the DRC Government, to cooperate with MONUC deployment and operations.
